Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: A round dartboard; confiscated from the cross-section of an aged cedar tree. The board is roughly four hands in diameter and divided into twenty equal sections radiating from the center via thin strands of metal wire. The center contains a red, hand-painted bullseye encircled by a green 'lesser' bullseye. There are also two concentric circles; the middle is triple points and the exterior is double points. The wood is cracked and pitted from excessive use. You may shoot a dart at it.
